thread.title: The Rams might be clearing cap space for next Aaron Donald contract
thread.title_full: The Rams might be clearing cap space for next Aaron Donald contract

title: The Rams might be clearing cap space for next Aaron Donald contract
text:
The Rams might be clearing cap space for next Aaron Donald contract The Rams might be clearing cap space for next Aaron Donald contract By Kevin Vote 8 hours ago 205 shares By: Kevin Vote | 8 hours ago 
Los Angeles Rams defensive tackle Aaron Donald is flipping that script this year, posting a video on Instagram of an insane workout sequence. 
While Rams fans are surely still celebrating the arrivals of receiver Robert Woods and offensive lineman Andrew Whitworth, Donald’s video cannot be ignored. Is it even possible for Donald to improve on his last few seasons? It looks like it. A post shared by Aaron Donald (@aarondonald99) on Mar 8, 2017 at 5:52am PST 
Every offseason during NFL free agency, some players get lost in the shuffle. Fans and media alike fixate on the unrestricted and restricted free agents, and the rest of the players momentarily fade into the background. 
Little attention is paid to those already under contract who improve in the offseason when the enticing prospect of instantly upgrading the roster is on the table. It’s natural. 
In three seasons with the Rams, Donald has 28 sacks, 115 solo tackles and four forced fumbles. Put it this way: They are preparing for it as we speak https://t.co/HvIuxjLNjQ 
— Vincent Bonsignore (@DailyNewsVinny) March 10, 2017 
With those numbers, Donald could become the top defensive tackle available in free agency next year when his contract expires. Unless of course, the Rams are clearing cap space and doing anything they can to keep Donald in Los Angeles. 
The Rams have extra cap space after trading William Hayes and dumping Tim Barnes, Eugene Sims and Tre Mason. 
Next season will be the last year of Donald’s rookie contract, in which he’ll make $1,802,250.00 as a base salary, so it’s likely he’ll want a deserved payday after that. 
Hopefully, the Rams continue doing anything and everything possible to make sure they’re the ones giving him the paycheck next offseason. Related:
